6, 9995, 9999

for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree or haven’t you heard enough to say: businesses implicated in corruption should be barred from doing business with the government

for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree or haven’t you heard enough to say: it is better to pay more for electricity for better services than paying less and receiving poor services

for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree or haven’t you heard enough to say: to ensure effectiveness in the supply of electricity in our country, eskom should be privatised

in your opinion, how often do the police in kenya: use excessive force when dealing with criminals
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: abuse or torture people in their custody
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: engage in criminal activities
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: operate in a professional manner and respect the rights of all citizens
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: stop drivers without good reason
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: use excessive force in managing protests or demostartions
in your opinion, how often do the police in lesotho: use excessive force when dealing with criminals

in your opinion, how often, in this country: are people treated unequally under the law
in your opinion, how often, in this country: do officials who commit crimes go unpunished
in your opinion, how often, in this country: do ordinary people who break the law go unpunished
in your opinion, how often, in this country: do people have to be careful of what they say about politics
in your opinion, how often, in this country: does competition between political parties lead to violent conflict
in your opinion, how often, in this country: does the [president] ignore [parliament] and just do what [he] wants
in your opinion, how often, in this country: does the [president] ignore the courts and laws of this country

in your opinion, should our government be doing more or less than it is currently doing to limit pollution and protect the environment in this country

in your opinion, what is the most serious threat to your safety and security in your neighborhood

let us talk for a moment about the economic situation in this country. please, tell me which of the following statements is closest to your view.  statement 1: for a more just and fairer society, the government should undertake to provide social security support to poor and vulnerable citizens in the country statement 2: all [country]ns should take care of themselves without expecting government support regardless of their economic situation
let us talk for a moment about the economic situation in this country. please, tell me which of the following statements is closest to your view.  statement 1: the costs of reforming the economy are too high; the government should therefore abandon its current economic policies statement 2: in order for the economy to get better in the future, it is necessary for us to accept some hardships now
let us talk for a moment about the economic situation in this country. please, tell me which of the following statements is closest to your view.  statement 1: the government’s economic policies have helped most people; only a few have suffered statement 2. the government’s economic policies have hurt most people and only benefited a few

now i would like to ask you some questions about foreign immigrants, that is people from other countries who wish to come, or have already arrived, to live and work in this country. please, tell me whether you, personally, think each of the following is a good or a bad thing: an immigrant starting a business that employs local people or moroccans
now i would like to ask you some questions about foreign immigrants, that is people from other countries who wish to come, or have already arrived, to live and work in this country. please, tell me whether you, personally, think each of the following is a good or a bad thing: having more immigrants coming to live in this country
now i would like to ask you some questions about foreign immigrants, that is people who wish or have come to live and work in this country from another country. for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree or haven’t you heard enough to say: since foreign migrants          help to fill job vacancies in both the public and private sectors in seychelles, our country should be welcoming them
now i would like to ask you some questions about foreign immigrants, that is people who wish or have come to live and work in this country from another country. for each of the following statements, please tell me whether you disagree or agree or haven’t you heard enough to say: to help the economy to grow, seychelles’ immigration policies should favour skilled foreigners and foreign investors

now let’s speak about the performance of the present government of this country. how well or badly would you say the current government is handling the following matters, or haven’t you heard enough to say: managing the economy
now let’s talk about environmental conditions in the country and in your community. which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should focus on creating jobs and increasing incomes, even if that means increasing pollution or other environmental damage.          statement 2: the government should focus more on preventing pollution and protecting the environment, even if this means there will be fewer jobs or there will be other disruptions to our daily lives
now let’s talk about environmental conditions in the country and in your community. which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should focus on creating jobs and increasing incomes, even if that means increasing pollution or other environmental damage. statement 2: the government should focus more on preventing pollution and protecting the environment, even if this means there will be fewer jobs or there will be other disruptions to our daily lives
now let’s talk about some policies introduced by the ministry of primary and secondary education between 2013 and 2020.  for each of the following policies, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: allowing pregnant girls to continue with their education
now let’s talk about some policies introduced by the ministry of primary and secondary education between 2013 and 2020.  for each of the following policies, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: banning corporal punishment in schools
now let’s talk about some policies introduced by the ministry of primary and secondary education between 2013 and 2020.  for each of the following policies, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: banning payment of both monetary and non-monetary incentives to teachers for extra lessons
now let’s talk about some policies introduced by the ministry of primary and secondary education between 2013 and 2020.  for each of the following policies, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: implementation of on-line lessons
now let’s talk about some policies introduced by the ministry of primary and secondary education between 2013 and 2020.  for each of the following policies, please tell me whether you disagree or agree: introducing continuous assessment and learning activities or cala projects by students
now let’s talk about weather events in your community.  in your experience, over the past 10 years, has there been any change in the severity of the following events in the area where you live? have they become more severe, less severe, or stayed about the same: drought
now let’s talk about witchcraft in this country. at the moment, the laws of [country] do not recognize the existence of witchcraft. the law commission is now proposing to change the law to recognize and criminalize witchcraft: in your community, which type of people are most associated with witchcraft
now let’s talk about witchcraft in this country. at the moment, the laws of [country] do not recognize the existence of witchcraft. the law commission is now proposing to change the law to recognize and criminalize witchcraft: please tell me, how much, if at all, do you believe that witchcraft exists

now let’s talk about witchcraft in this country. at the moment, the laws of [country] do not recognize the existence of witchcraft. the law commission is now proposing to change the law to recognize and criminalize witchcraft: which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2? statement 1: the current laws that do not recognize witchcraft have served the country well and should be maintained. statement 2: the laws of our country should be changed to recognize and criminalize witchcraft

now, i would like to hear your views about the current situation in this country compared to the situation under former president omar al bashir. can you please tell me whether you think the country has improved, stayed the same or worsened in the following areas: freedom of citizens to speak

now, i would like to hear your views about the current situation in this country compared to the situation under former president omar al bashir. can you please tell me whether you think the country has improved, stayed the same or worsened in the following areas: narrowing income gap between the rich and the poor
now, i would like to hear your views about the current situation in this country compared to the situation under former president omar al bashir. can you please tell me whether you think the country has improved, stayed the same or worsened in the following areas: respect for human rights

thinking of your journey here: was the road at the start point in the psu or ea:
thinking of your journey here: what was the condition of the road in the last 5 kilometers before reaching the start point of the psu or ea? was the road in excellent or good condition and easy to traverse, or was it in poor or very poor condition, that is, difficult to traverse due to potholes, waterlogging, or other issues, or was it impassable at any point (e.g., due to a collapsed bridge, fallen tree, flooding, etc.)

thinking of your journey here: what was the most common surface of the road over the last 5 kilometers before arriving at the start point of the psu or ea
time interview ended

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2          statement 1: after losing an election, opposition parties should monitor and criticize the government in order to hold it accountable. statement 2: once an election is over, opposition parties and politicians should accept defeat and cooperate with government to help it develop the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2          statement 1: men make better political leaders than women, and should be elected rather than women. statement 2: women should have the same chance of being elected to political office as men
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2          statement 1: parliament should ensure that the prime minister explains to it on a regular basis how his government spends taxpayers’ money. statement 2: the prime minister should be able to devote his full attention to developing the country rather than wasting time justifying his actions

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.            statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong

which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is better to have free primary and secondary education for our children, even if the quality is low. statement 2: it is more important to raise  education standards, even if parents have to pay school fees for it
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does.          statement 2: it is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: it is more important to have a government that can get things done, even if we have no influence over what it does. statement 2: it is more important for citizens to be able to hold government accountable, even if that means it makes decisions more slowly
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: people who are responsible for past political crimes or human rights violations should be granted amnesty so that the country can move forward.  statement 2: individuals who are responsible for past political crimes or human rights violations should be held accountable and face consequences for what they have done
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the [president] was elected to lead the country, [he] should not be bound by laws or court decisions that [he] thinks are wrong.           statement 2: the [president] must always obey the laws and the courts, even if [he] thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if [he] thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the president was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the president must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: since the prime minister was elected to lead the country, he should not be bound by laws or court decisions that he thinks are wrong.  statement 2: the prime minister must always obey the laws and the courts, even if he thinks they are wrong
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the constitution should be amended to allow the president to appoint cabinet ministers from outside parliament.  statement 2: the current system where cabinet ministers are drawn from parliament has served botswana well and must be maintained
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government is like the people’s boss. people should respect the government and do what it directs. statement 2: the government is like the people’s employee. it should respect the citizens and do what they request
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the government should be able to ban any organization that goes against its policies. statement 2: we should be able to join any organization, whether or not the government approves of it
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the independent electoral commission or iec performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by law.  statement 2: the independent electoral commission or iec makes decisions that favor particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the law should be changed to allow new presidents to hire his or her own director of public prosecutions to help them advance their government’s agenda statement 2: in order to promote independence in the prosecution of cases, new presidents should not be allowed to fire existing holders of the office of the director of public prosecutions as is the current practice
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the national electoral commission or cne of sao tome and principe performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by law. statement 2: the national electoral commission or cne of sao tome and principe makes decisions that favour particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption.          statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the news media should constantly investigate and report on government mistakes and corruption. statement 2: too much reporting on negative events, like government mistakes and corruption, only harms the country
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: the practice of having specially elected members of parliament is no longer relevant and should be discontinued. statement 2: the practice of having specially elected members of parliament is still relevant for botswana’s democracy and should therefore be maintained
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: we should choose our leaders in this country through regular, open and honest elections. statement 2: since elections sometimes produce bad results, we should adopt other methods for choosing this country’s leaders
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2.  statement 1: when job vacancies become available, employers should always prioritise recruitment of seychellois citizens.  statement 2: when hiring workers, companies should focus on qualifications of candidates regardless of their nationality
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. do you agree or agree very strongly? statement 1:  it is more important for government to invest in good infrastructure such as roads and railways even if this means taking loans to finance the projects. statement 2:  government should not take loans to finance new infrastructural projects to avoid bequeathing future generations a large debt burden
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: because of ethiopia’s cultural and linguistic diversity, some type of federalism with independent regional governments is still the best form of government for the country statement 2: because federalism based on cultural and linguistic identity sometimes leads to conflicts; ethiopia should change to a unitary government in which the central government has more authority in decision making
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: despite the introduction of the new electronic financial transaction levy, i will use or continue to use electronic financial transactions. statement 2: the introduction of the new electronic financial transaction levy will make me avoid or stop using electronic financial transactions
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: if ethiopia remains a federal system, then the current system of federalism, where regions are defined based on nations, nationalities and peoples’ identity, should be kept. statement 2: if ethiopia remains a federal system, it should change to a system where regions are based only on geographical boundaries, not on where different nations, nationalities, and peoples live
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: if funds for schooling are limited, a boy should always receive an education in school before a girl. statement 2: if funds for schooling are limited, a family should send the child with the greatest ability to learn
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: if government offers direct support to political parties, all registered political parties must benefit from such support. statement 2: only political parties that meet conditions, such as having a large enough base of support, should benefit if government offers direct support to political parties
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: in order to reduce the transmission of covid-19, the government must extend vaccination to children who are 12 years and above. statement 2: since children are less likely to exhibit serious symptoms for covid-19, there is no need to vaccinate them
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: it is important for the government to only spend resources that it is able to generate, even if this means cutting down on services to the people statement 2: it is important to have quality public services even if this means government getting into debt to pay for it
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the constitution of sierra leone has failed to deal with the country’s governance challenges and therefore needs to be replaced with a new one. statement 2: the current constitution of sierra leone has   served the country well and should not be changed
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the current mixed member proportional system where voters choose both constituency candidates and party lists has served lesotho well and should be maintained. statement 2: we should change our electoral system to one where all members of parliament are directly elected by voters from clearly demarcated constituencies
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the current system where parliament chooses the president should be changed to allow for direct election of the president. statement 2: the current system where the president of the country is chosen by parliament has served [country] well and should be maintained
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the e-levy is a good idea because it means that more [country]ians will contribute to the country’s tax revenues. statement 2: the e-levy is a bad idea because it means that more tax burden will be put on the poor and on ordinary citizens
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the media should have the right to publish any views and ideas without government control. statement 2: the government should have the right to prevent the media from publishing things that it disapproves of
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the national reforms authority or nra performs its duties as a neutral body guided only by          law. statement 2: the national reforms authority or nra makes decisions that favor particular people, parties or interests
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: the sao tome and principe courts carry out their tasks as independent authority guided only by the law statement 2: sao tome and principe courts make decisions that favour certain people or political parties
which of the following statements is closest to your view? choose statement 1 or statement 2. statement 1: when faced with a pandemic such as covid-19, the government must make it mandatory for all citizens to be vaccinated. statement 2: citizens should have the right to choose whether to take up vaccines or not, even during times of pandemics such as covid-19

with regards to land use and security of tenure for this household, to what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements, or haven’t you heard enough to say? i feel secure enough with the current land tenure arrangement for this family home
with regards to land use and security of tenure for this household, to what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements, or haven’t you heard enough to say? the current land tenure arrangement for this family home allows us to fully utilize or develop this land
with regards to land use and security of tenure for this household, to what extent do you agree or disagree with each of the following statements, or haven’t you heard enough to say? the current land tenure gives this family home sufficient security to access financial credit or loan facilities
